result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron R. LEWIS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence presently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Obtain high school diploma or GED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

No contact with any known drug dealers or users.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron R. LEWIS

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on WRIT.
The State moves to amend the charge in count 1 to deliver cocaine (>1G but <=5G),  contrary to Section 946.41(10(cm)1r  of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Court grants motion.  State will file an Amended Information.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 1.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report be completed by DOC.
PSI due on 06-17-16.
Sentencing is set for 07-01-16 at 9:30 a.m.
Court orders defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a plea date on 04-21-16 at 2:00 p.m.
Copy filed.

Defendant was taken to prison. No writ was prepared.
Plea date is reset to 04-21-16 at 2:00 p.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 04-07-2016 at 2:30 p.m., Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 02:30 pm
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in person.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 02-18-16 at 3:45 p.m.
Attorney Falk withdraws the bail modification motion.  Court deems the motion withdrawn.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Motion to Modify Bond.
Cover letter.
Marcus Falk, through public defender.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-01-16 at 10:00 a.m.
Minutes.
RE:  Deliver cocaine, on 01-21-16.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of deliver cocaine and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol and have no contact with Donald W. McGraw, III.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
